holidays.name: International Whale Shark Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the gentle giants of the ocean ‚Äì the whale sharks! These massive creatures are the largest fish species on Earth and are known for their peaceful nature.
holidays.origin: Established by marine conservation groups to raise awareness about whale shark protection and ocean conservation.
holidays.funFact: Whale sharks can grow as long as a school bus and live up to 70 years or more!

holidays.name: National Toasted Marshmallow Day (USA)
holidays.description: A yummy celebration honoring the gooey, golden-crisp perfection of toasted marshmallows, perfect for campfires and s'mores!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday created by marshmallow and camping enthusiasts to enjoy the iconic treat.
holidays.funFact: The earliest marshmallows were made from the root sap of the marshmallow plant before becoming the sweet snack we know today.

holidays.name: Spider-Man Day
holidays.description: A day to swing into action and celebrate everyone's favorite web-slinging superhero, Spider-Man!
holidays.origin: Officially recognized in New York City in 2015 to honor the iconic comic book and film character created by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko.
holidays.funFact: Spider-Man was the first teenage superhero who wasn‚Äôt a sidekick, inspiring generations to embrace responsibility with their powers.

holidays.name: More Herbs, Less Salt Day
holidays.description: A health-conscious observance encouraging people to enhance their meals with herbs instead of salt to reduce sodium intake and promote wellness.
holidays.origin: Created by health advocates to inspire healthier cooking habits and awareness of the dangers of excessive salt.
holidays.funFact: Herbs like basil and rosemary not only boost flavor but also contain antioxidants and vitamins!
